TopicTitle: Modifying a collider on a part

Articles.Content:
I'm trying to build a part that fits the MK3 cargo bay snugly.

The obvious solution would be scaling it down a notch, except for that pesky floor.

I've loaded the model in Blender and edited the Mk3COL/Mk3Collider object...

(I didn't touch the actual textured model, I'll try adapting it once I get this working).

...but it seems that's not enough. The cargo still jumps up as soon as the docking port is released. What else do I need to do? Probably Unity is involved somehow...

Its kind of hard to follow your issue. could you elaborate a bit better with pictures of your part? how did you modify the collider?

@cxg2827

That was the original collider's profile - the MK3 fuselage.

Using the Merge tool, I removed two vertices highlighted off the top of the rounded part, merging them into the neighbors (repeating the process 4 times, top/bottom, both ends).

Hi, i may have completely the wrong end of the stick here, but, if the first image is the collider as it was and the second image is how you have modified it, then it seems like you've actually reduced the area you have to use rather than increasing it. 

From the looks of the very first image you posted  that collider follows the outer shape of the the fuselage quite closely(which is a pleasant change) and does not have a flat portion where the floor should be, I reckon the floor is a separate collider, likely a box, which would explain why your changes have not altered the behavior.

I would think the bay collider is three boxes, given they all have to be concave edit: I'm an idiot, convex of course - I need to sleep more - if you import the .mu into blender you should get all the colliders. I'd be very surprised if the external cargo bay collider was a solid section of Mk3 shape, or you'd never be able to put anything inside it.

Edit: yep, bay body colliders all highlighted.
